Bill Nelson.title: The Romance Of Sustain
Bill Nelson.about:
'The Romance Of Sustain' is Volume One of the 'Painting With Guitars' series, originally released in 2003. It is a guitar-based instrumental album containing several pieces performed in concert over the years, including the now classic 'For Stuart', which was composed for the Glasgow Barrowlands tribute concert to honour the late Stuart Adamson of Skids and Big Country fame. The album also contains several tracks that were written specifically for the original release and never performed live. This digital re-issue comes ahead of the CD release of the album 'Plectrajet: Painting With Guitars Volume Two' which gathers together even more of my live performance material.
Originally released as a limited edition CD in 2003.
Catalogue No. Universal Twang Records UTCD 001
The digital download includes all of the albums original artwork in PDF format.
For further album information and fan reviews visit  www.billnelson.com/romance-of-sustain

Bill Nelson.title: The Sparkle Machine
Bill Nelson.about:
'The Sparkle Machine (Several Sustained Moments)' is an album of exploratory guitar-based instrumentals. The 14 tracks feature complex layers of atmospherically processed guitar sounds which constantly flicker, flow and mutate through each piece. This is a richly textured album which will reward repeated listening and initiate wide-screen, neo-psychedelic guitar dreams.
Originally released December 2013 on Sonoluxe CD028
Duration. 71:45
This download version includes all CD cover artwork in PDF format.
For further album information and fan reviews visit  www.billnelson.com/sparkle-machine

Bill Nelson.title: The Summer Of God's Piano
Bill Nelson.about:
'The Summer Of God's Piano' was originally released in 1985, the first of the 4-LP box set 'Trial By Intimacy (The Book Of Splendours)'.
Then released for the first time on CD in 1989.
"These were all recorded on very simple equipment, (which is all I had at the time), hence the 'home hobbyist' sound. They were created over a few months, rather than years, if my memory serves me. As always, the titles play an important role in how I intend the music to be heard. They set up a context, an anticipation and an imaginary or real environment for the music to unfold in."
This digital download includes CD artwork as PDF files.
For further information and fan reviews please visit:  www.billnelson.com/trial-by-intimacy

Bill Nelson.title: The Two-Fold Aspect Of Everything
Bill Nelson.about:
The Two-Fold Aspect of Everything was initially issued in 1985 as a double album on vinyl on Cocteau Records.
The double vinyl was condensed into a single CD for UK release in 1989.
Tracks 1 - 10 are taken from the first of these, ‘Eaux d’artifice’, a collection of B-sides and rarities which had previously never been available on an album, and which had (at the time) never been presented in compact disc form.
Tracks 11 - 22 comprised the ‘Confessions Of A Four-Track Mind’ LP, made up of domestically recorded four-track demo tapes, which due to a lack of time, were never developed further.
Although their technical qualities are somewhat dubious, these songs are presented in their charmingly naive and natural state.
The download includes printable album artwork.
For further details follow the link to the album's page on Dreamsville:  www.billnelson.com/two-fold-aspect

Bill Nelson.title: The Years
Bill Nelson.about:
The Years is an instrumental album that was first released on CD in June 2015. The limited run of copies sold out in just one month.
The music on the album, in the main, is kind of kitsch and easy-listening, quite jolly in parts but with deeper reflective moments. As always, it's not turned out quite the way I expected. It's not as pure or perfect as I'd hoped, but it's been made very spontaneously with a feeling of urgency. It's not an album that I've pondered too deeply or furrowed my brow about. It's emerged almost of its own accord.
The download comes with complete PDF artwork.
For further info, including some great fan reviews, check out the album's page on  www.billnelson.com/the-years

Bill Nelson.about:
'Theatre Of Falling Leaves' is an instrumental album, originally released as a limited edition CD in 2009.
"A keyboard-based instrumental album with just a hint of lap-steel guitar on a couple of tracks. The predominant tonality centres on synths and treated piano. The pieces shift through various changes within their individual length but there's plenty of melodic content and beats that drift in and out of the frame. There's even a cute and ironic disco track with a retro feel to it." - Bill Nelson.

Bill Nelson.title: Transcorder
Bill Nelson.about:
‘Acquitted By Mirrors’ was a Bill Nelson Fan Club magazine published between 1982 and 1990. By its 13th issue in 1986, seven EPs – all of which were recorded on either 4-track or 8-track analogue recording equipment at The Echo Observatory (Bill’s home studio) – were issued exclusively to fan club members in conjunction with alternating issues of the magazine. While some of the tracks can now be found on various CD releases, many others are making their long-awaited CD debut with this release.
As well as having all the fan club EPs together on CD for the first time, ‘Transcorder’ also includes hard-to-find B-sides and rare tracks. The album ultimately closes with five previously unreleased instrumentals that were recorded at The Echo Observatory during the mid-1980s.
This download comes complete with album artwork as PDF files.
For further information, take a look at the album's page on the discography section of the Bill Nelson website.  www.billnelson.com/transcorder

Bill Nelson.title: Tripping The Light Fantastic
Bill Nelson.about:
’Tripping The Light Fantastic’ is only the second live album I’ve ever officially released. The first was Be Bop Deluxe’s ‘Live In The Air Age’ album, way back in the distant 1970s. A great deal of ‘time saturated’ water has flowed under all our rickety bridges since then, but this new live album captures a brief moment in that same flow of time.
Sensibilities change, both on the part of the audience, and also every artist worthy of the term ‘artist’ over the years, but I’m very happy to say that my audience has grown with my own development and peculiar sensibilities throughout the years. This isn’t music from then, but music from ’now,’ (though the now is always in flux and shifting, as am I.)
So, it is to those loyal, enthusiastic, brilliant listeners that I dedicate this album.
Bill Nelson 2017.
This digital download version includes different artwork than the limited edition 500 CD pressing, catalogue number Sonoluxe CD044.
For further album information and fan reviews visit  www.billnelson.com/tripping-the-light-fantastic

Bill Nelson.title: Weird Critters
Bill Nelson.about:
Originally released in 1997 as part of a 2CD box-set entitled 'Confessions Of A Hyperdreamer', a double album of archive material recorded over the period 1992-95.
"'Weird Critters', is a mixture of vocal and instrumental recordings from my somewhat minimalist home studio.
All of the music was composed 'Direct-to-tape', utilising first takes wherever possible. The result is a kind of 'Sonic Snapshot'... an idea frozen in time at its moment of conception.
Whilst there was no pre-determined form for these pieces, I nevertheless tried to retain a sense of lightness and playfulness... like a boy having fun with his toys on a rainy day. These recordings are neither high-fidelity nor low-fidelity but simply true to the moment, and for me, that moment is always changing." - Bill Nelson
The download, as always, comes with album artwork as PDF files.
Please visit  www.billnelson.com/confessions-hyperdreamer  for further details and fan reviews.

Bill Nelson.title: Whimsy Two (A Garage Full Of Clouds)
Bill Nelson.about:
'Whimsy Two (A Garage Full Of Clouds)' is the second disc of the double-album package, originally released on CD in 2003, along with 'Whimsy'.
It contains a collection of vocal tracks that had been recorded during the previous couple of years, and features the first set of recordings made on Bill's (at the time) new Mackie multi-track recording equipment.
This release comes complete with downloadable PDF artwork.
For further information and fan reviews head to  www.billnelson.com/whimsy

Bill Nelson.title: Whistling While The World Turns
Bill Nelson.about:
Originally released on CD in 2000, 'Whistling While the World Turns' is a collection of (at the time) previously unreleased tracks and covers a range of styles mixing instrumental and vocal pieces.
The album was intended as a teaser for the 6CD box set, 'Noise Candy'.
But 'Whistling While the World Turns' is actually more of a companion release to 'Noise Candy', since 11 of the 17 tracks are exclusive to this release.
The download comes complete with PDF artwork.
For further information and fan reviews, please visit  www.billnelson.com/whistling-while-world-turns

Bill Nelson.title: Contemplation-2007
Bill Nelson.about: Originally released on the Getting The Holy Ghost Across album in 1986 (USA Title: On A Blue Wing). Bill re-recorded this unique extended 11 minute version of Contemplation and performed it as part of his live set for the Nelsonica 2007 Fan Convention.
Bill Nelson.credits:
released November 30, 2007
Composed and Performed by Bill Nelson.
